reused_details.reused: (Photo: Reuters) By Reuters: The North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (Nato) on Sunday criticised Russia for its "dangerous and irresponsible" nuclear rhetoric, a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia would station tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus.
reused_by_aic: NATO has criticised Russia's plans to base tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus as "dangerous and irresponsible" as Ukraine pushed for an emergency UN meeting to discuss the issue.
The military alliance condemned the move after Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow plans to station the weapons in neighbouring Belarus.?

In an interview, Putin argued that by deploying its tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus, Russia was following the lead of the United States, noting that the US has nuclear weapons based in Belgium, Germany, Greece, Italy, the Netherlands and Turkey.
RUSSIA/UKRAINE CONFLICT While US downplayed the move, saying there are no indications Russia will use nuclear weapons?, NATO said Putin's remarks were misleading.

Ukraine's government on Sunday called for an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council to "counter the Kremlin's nuclear blackmail" after Putin revealed plans to station tactical atomic weapons in Belarus.

reused_details.reused: "Nato is vigilant, and we are closely monitoring the situation.
reused_by_aic: "NATO is vigilant, and we are closely monitoring the situation.

reused_details.reused: We have not seen any changes in Russia's nuclear posture that would lead us to adjust our own," a Nato spokesperson said.
reused_by_aic: We have not seen any changes in Russia's nuclear posture that would lead us to adjust our own," said NATO spokesperson Oana Lungescu.

reused_details.reused: "Russia's reference to Nato's nuclear sharing is totally misleading.
reused_by_aic:

"Russia's reference to NATO's nuclear sharing is totally misleading," Lungescu said, referring to Putin's claims that his move would merely mirror those of Western nations.

The military alliance condemned the move after Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow plans to station the weapons in neighbouring Belarus.?

reused_details.reused: Tactical nuclear weapons refer to those used for specific gains on a battlefield rather than those with the capacity to wipe out cities.
reused_by_aic: Tactical nuclear weapons are intended for use on the battlefield, unlike more powerful, longer-range strategic nuclear weapons.
